notesStmt.note: Defective at the beginning and at the end.
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

collation.p: Folios 1-101: 13 quires of originally 8 leaves each. One leaf is missing after folio 52, and two leaves are wanting after folio 66. Folio 102 begins a new quire, the subsequent leaves of which are currently missing. About 1 quire is missing at the beginning.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Ashkenazi (Greek style) square script of the end of the 13th or beginning of the 14th century.

binding.p: Post-1600. Blind-tooled brown leather. Modern BL box. Spine title: Tractatus Talmudici. Tres. Hebr. Mus. Brit. Iure Empt. 25, 717.'

history.provenance: Acquisition: Joseph Leves: purchased from him by the British Museum on 09 July 1864: inscribed, folio [103v].
